ygData.messageBody:
you should definitely work on all weapon skills...  just keep an eye on you skill, as it goes up, so that you know when to switch to a different weapon.  the formula for weapons skills is this:  (level * 5) +5  so, at 11, your skill should max at 60.  as soon as your skill hits 60 with one weapon, switch to a different skill.  do this each level, if you can.  i neglected to do this with my ranger, and am now paying for it.  i am trying to raise my 2hb, and 1hb from nothing, and am level 42.....  which means, since i solo, i take much more dmg than i should, because of being so slow to kill the mob with those weapons....  when you get dual wield, it will be easier for you to keep 1hs, piercing, and 1hb maxed, as you can slip 1 of each type into a hand, and still do a considerable amount of dmg, while increasing 2 skills at once.  hope this helps..
 
Naedarie
----- Original Message -----
From: Rob LeBeau
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, July 10, 2002 10:35 AM
Subject: [EverQuest] Warrior and skills question

Ok, I have a level 11 warrior and would like your
opinion on the following:

I started wondering why I was not hitting that much
with him even though he has a good weapon. After some
research, I found that the reason I am not hitting as
much as others is because I have been switching
between 2HS and 1HS weapons to increase the skills of
each attribute. 

Example: My skill in both is 25, let's say and my
attack is at like 152.  If I were to just use 1HS
let's say, my ATK rating would be like close to 300.

I have proved this because now that I am using the 1HS
more, the skill is close to 30 and my ATK rating is
close to 200 where with a 2HS weapon, it is still at
152.


Would you continue to alternate both weapon types or
would you just pick one and go with it?

THanks
